graphics

Interface BufferedDevice

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BufferedCanvas, BufferedFrame, BufferedJFrame, BufferedJPanel

    public interface BufferedDevice
    BufferedDevices are GUI components with built-in image drawing and manipulation functions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Removes all images.
      void disableFpsCounter()
      Disables the device's FPS counter.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        void render()
        Renders a frame. Runs every time the game clock advances a tick.

      • drawImage

        Sprite drawImage(java.awt.Image image,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Draws an image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image you want drawn.
        x - The x-value of the image's upper-left corner on the destination frame.
        y - The y-value of the image's upper-left corner on the destination frame.
        Returns:
        The generated sprite containing the image identifier and the display coordinates of the image.

      • drawImage

        Sprite drawImage(java.awt.Image image,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int endx,
                 int endy)
        Draws an image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image you want drawn.
        x - The x-value of the image's upper-left corner on the destination frame.
        y - The y-value of the image's upper-left corner on the destination frame.
        endx - The x-value of the image's lower-right corner on the destination frame.
        endy - The y-value of the image's lower-right corner on the destination frame.
        Returns:
        The generated sprite containing the image identifier and the display coordinates of the image.

      • drawImage

        Sprite drawImage(java.awt.Image image,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int endx,
                 int endy,
                 int srcx1,
                 int srcy1,
                 int srcx2,
                 int srcy2)
        Draws an image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image you want drawn.
        x - The x-value of the image's upper-left corner on the destination frame.
        y - The y-value of the image's upper-left corner on the destination frame.
        endx - The x-value of the image's lower-right corner on the destination frame.
        endy - The y-value of the image's lower-right corner on the destination frame.
        srcx1 - The x-value of the upper-left corner of the bounds on the source image.
        srcy1 - The y-value of the upper-left corner of the bounds on the source image.
        srcx2 - The x-value of the bottom-right corner of the bounds on the source image.
        srcy2 - The y-value of the bottom-right corner of the bounds on the source image.
        Returns:
        The generated sprite containing the image identifier and the display coordinates of the image.

      • moveImage

        void moveImage(int id,
               int x,
               int y)
        Moves an image.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the image to be moved.
        x - The x-value of the image's upper-left corner on the destination frame.
        y - The y-value of the image's upper-left corner on the destination frame.
